page.title: 08GEOLOGY OF THE AREA
page.content: {Reading Beds:}being largely sand are of little use for agriculture and in the past grew little but scrubby trees and firs. But does provide good builders sand. {Alluvium:}surrounding the course of the R.Frome gives virtually flat and valuable agricultural land. The area south of Islington had a very sophisticated system of drainage. The object of this system was to enable grass to be grown earlier in the spring.These systems have been abandoned because of the large amounts of skilled labour required to keep them working. {Gravel:}are of little agricultural use and are covered by heathlands. {Chalk:}is usually used for sheep grazing.
